hero.title: Books Beyond Borders
hero.subtitle: A SanMargam Bharatanatyam fundraiser powering USKids4Water’s Library Learning & Rural Tech Hub in Perayur, Tamil Nadu.

home.about: Books Beyond Borders brings technology, language learning, and creativity to rural students. Your support launches a Rural Tech Hub and Library Learning space in Perayur—computers and internet, coding and robotics, English practice, and inspiring reading corners.
home.dancersTrioCaption: Principal dancers — Sahana Kumar, Kirthana Warrier & Sarika Rajan

uskids4water.mission: USKids4Water elevates awareness—and action—around water, environment, health, and education. Guided by the mission to “sow the seed of empathy in everyone’s mind,” student volunteers (with mentor support) design and deliver projects that build skills, expand opportunity, and foster service-minded leadership.

pillars.education: Spoken English Program (1:1 and group coaching), Alphabet Commanders (vocabulary/spelling), digital literacy & STEM/robotics, and career-awareness sessions connecting learners with professionals.
pillars.environment: Save Water / Save Electricity campaigns, tree-planting and recycling drives, and local sustainability projects (including wells and community conservation challenges).
pillars.health: Community wellness initiatives: hygiene & sanitation education, mental-health awareness activities, nutrition guidance, and periodic food/hygiene kit drives.

program.message: The full program will be unveiled during the event.

dancers.name: Sahana Kumar
dancers.bioShort: A Bharatanatyam dancer and media-arts storyteller, Sahana blends classical technique with contemporary themes. She volunteers with USKids4Water and narrates the feature video.

dancers.name: Sarika Rajan
dancers.bioShort: Sarika’s dynamic stage presence reflects years of disciplined training. She contributes to outreach efforts that expand access to arts and education.

dancers.name: Kirthana Warrier
dancers.bioShort: Kirthana brings grace and precision to each piece, with a focus on abhinaya and rhythm. She supports youth education and environmental causes through performance.
